page.title: 20THE CAUSEWAY
page.content: The Causeway has various places of interest for visitors to the Horsham area. The Museum has exhibits dating from Stone Age times. It has toys, books and a 200 year old doll which was found beneath the floor boards of a local shop. They also have some old sport gear and a smoking suit which belonged to one of Queen Victoria's sons. The town hall is often used for fund raising events e.g jumble sales, bazaars etc. It used to be the home of the local Magistrates Court and had cells in the basement for the prisoners appearing. St.Mary's Church is at the end of the Causeway. Its first vicar was Roger of Wallingford in 1231. The tower and door way date back to Saxon and Norman times.
